column1: What can you declare using `Field` in Pydantic models?
column2: You can declare validation and metadata inside of Pydantic models using `Field`.

column1: Which module should you import `Field` from?
How does `Field` work in Pydantic models?
column2: `Field` works the same way as `Query`, `Path` and `Body`, it has all the same parameters.

column1: What happens when you pass extra keys to `Field`?
column2: Extra keys passed to `Field` will also be present in the resulting OpenAPI schema for your application, but some OpenAPI tools may not work with your generated schema.

column1: What is the purpose of using `Field` with model attributes?
column2: You can declare extra validations and metadata for model attributes using `Field`.
